week3.practice1_html:
What it is

Win Your Day with Breakfast is about starting your morning with a balanced, protein-rich meal that lowers stress hormones and fuels steady energy. By giving your body nutrients early, you anchor your metabolism so your hair and mood feel more stable all day.

Why this practice matters for you now

Katie, youâ€™re entering the stabilization phaseâ€”shedding is easing, but regrowth can only thrive when blood sugar and hormones calm down. With perimenopause and ongoing stress still nudging your sleep and cortisol, this practice is your â€œbig domino.â€ A steady, proteinâ€‘centered breakfast gives your follicles the amino acids and hormonal balance they need to shift toward regrowth as your body steadies into early 2026.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Commit to breakfast within one hour of waking. Keep it simple: eggs with spinach and avocado, or Greek yogurt with berries and chia seeds.
  2. Hit 25â€“30â€¯g of protein. Mix and matchâ€”two eggs + Â½â€¯cup Greek yogurt, or a smoothie with pea protein, almond butter, banana, and oats.
  3. Include color and healthy fats. Add one fruit or veg and a drizzle of olive or flaxseed oil for antiâ€‘inflammatory support.
  4. Rotate ideas. Try one vegan (tofu scramble, protein oatmeal) and one omnivore option so you donâ€™t get bored.
  5. Plan ahead. Batchâ€‘prep smoothie packs or overnight oats on Sundayâ€”make it easy for your 6â€¯a.m. self.

What to look for

  • Early wins: Smoother midâ€‘morning energy, fewer sugar crashes, and less shedding during stressful mornings within 7â€“14â€¯days.
  • Watchâ€‘outs: Skipping breakfast after a night of <6â€¯hoursâ€™ sleep can send stress hormones soaringâ€”set a reminder and eat even a small meal.
  • Consistency builds momentumâ€”one nourishing morning at a time. ğŸŒ±
week3.practice2_html:

week3.practice3_html:
